w:r.w:t: 최첨단과학기술의 모든 부문 모든 단위에서 자기부문 자기단위에 주신 장군님의 유훈을 한치의 드팀없이 무조건 관철하여야 합니다.
콤퓨터와 사람과의 련결을 보장해주는데서 건반이 차지하는 몫은 대단히 크다.
또한 건반은 콤퓨터뿐만이 아니라 여러가지 매몰형장치들에서도 사람과 장치와의 호상
의사소통을 보장하는데서 중요한 역할을 하고있다. 그러므로 건반을 보조하는 장치 Driver와 쏘프트웨어적기능에
대한 연구를 심화시켜 모든 장치들에 건반을 통한 입출력을 보장해 줌으로써 편리하고 다기능적인 대화를 보장해주는것이 중요하다.
was created to unify scattered drivers that handle diverse classes of
data-input devices such as keyboards, mice, trackballs, joysticks, roller wheels, touch screens,
accelerometers, and tablets. The input subsystem brings the following advantages to the table:
Uniform handling of functionally similar input devices even when they are physically
different. For example, all mice, such as PS/2, USB or Bluetooth, are treated alike.
An easy event interface for dispatching input reports to user applications. Your driver does
not have to create and manage /
nodes and related access methods. Instead, it can
simply invoke input APIs to send mouse movements, key presses, or touch events upstream
to user land. Applications such as X Windows work seamlessly over the event interfaces
Extraction of common portions out of input drivers and a resulting abstraction that simplifies
the drivers and introduces consistency. For example, the input subsystem offers a collection
that provides access to input hardware such as serial ports
.1 illustrates the operation of the input subsystem. The subsystem contains two classes of
with input devices. The mouse event generator,
, is an example of the former, and the
PS/2 mouse driver is an example of the latter. Both event drivers and device drivers can avail the
services of an efficient, bug-free, reusable core, which lies at the heart of the input subsystem.

This is a collection of drivers that is designed to support all input devices under Linux. While it is currently used only on for USB input devices, future use is expected to expand to replace most of the existing input system, which is why it lives in drivers/input.
The center of the input drivers is the input module, which must be loaded before any other of the input modules - it serves as a way of communication between two groups of modules:
These modules get events from input and pass them where needed via various interfaces - keystrokes to the kernel, mouse movements via a simulated PS/2 interface to GPM and X and so on.
These modules talk to the hardware (for example via USB), and provide
events (keystrokes, mouse movements) to the input module.
services of an efficient, bug-free, reusable core, which lies at the heart of the input subsystem.
are standardized and available for all input classes, you are more likely to
can use a suitable existing event
driver via the input core to interface with user applications.

The event interfaces exported by the input subsystem have evolved into a standard that many graphical
offer a hardware-independent abstraction to talk to input devices,
just as the frame buffer interface presents a generic mechanism to
communicate with display devices. Event drivers, in tandem with frame buffer drivers, insulate graphical user
interfaces (GUIs) from the vagaries of the underlying hardware.
is a generic input event driver. Each event packet produced by

may be used to 'seed' initial state of a switch or initial position of absolute axis, etc.

event interface, but input devices such as keyboards, mice, and touch controllers have custom event drivers. We will look at them when we discuss the corresponding device drivers.

These modules talk to the hardware (for example via USB), and provide events (keystrokes, mouse movements) to the input module. Device drivers are the modules that generate events. The events are however not useful without being handled, so you also will need to use some of the modules from the input.
is the largest and most complex driver of the whole suite. It
handles all HID devices, and because there is a very wide variety of them,
and because the USB HID specification isn't simple, it needs to be this big.
Currently, it handles USB mice, joysticks, gamepads, steering wheels
However, USB uses HID also for monitor controls, speaker controls, UPSs,
The monitor and speaker controls should be easy to add to the hid/input
interface, but for the UPSs and LCDs it doesn't make much sense. For this,
module is very simple, it takes no parameters,
detects everything automatically and when a HID device is inserted, it
However, because the devices vary wildly, you might happen to have a
device that doesn't work well. In that case #
and send me the syslog traces.

, and so on. Each type has a specific input device driver, but all use the same keyboard event driver, thus ensuring a consistent interface to their users. The keyboard event driver, however, has a distinguishing feature compared to other event drivers: It passes data to another kernel subsystem (the
layer), rather than to user space via /

(also called PS/2 keyboard or AT keyboard) interfaces with the processor via an i8042-compatible keyboard controller. Desktops usually have a dedicated keyboard controller, but on laptops, keyboard interfacing is one of the responsibilities of a general-purpose embedded controller .When you press a key on a PC
this is the road it takes:
(or the embedded controller) scans and decodes the keyboard matrix and takes care of nuances such as key

from the keyboard controller for each key press and release. The difference between a press and a release is in the most significant bit, which is set for the latter. A push on the "a" key, for example, yields a pair of
, 0x1e and 0x9e. Special keys are escaped using 0xE0, so a jab on the right-arrow key produces the sequence, (0xE0 0x4D 0xE0 0xCD). You may use the
emanating from the controller (the symbol attaches explanations):

is tied to actions such as switching the virtual console or rebooting the system. To glow the CAPSLOCK and NUMLOCK LEDs instead of rebooting the system in response to a

handler of the keyboard event driver, drivers/char/
is sent to the associated virtual terminal and the N_TTY line discipline. This is done as follows by drivers/char/
The N_TTY line discipline processes the input thus received from the keyboard, echoes it to the virtual console, and lets user-space applications read characters from the /
node connected to the virtual terminal.

shows the data flow from the time you push a key on your keyboard until the time it's echoed on your virtual console. The left half of the figure is hardware-specific, and the right half is generic. As per the design goal of the input subsystem, the underlying hardware interface is transparent to the keyboard event driver and the
layer. The input core and the clearly defined event interfaces thus insulate input users from the intricacies of the hardware.
Data flow from a PS/2-compatible keyboard.
stipulate the protocol that USB keyboards, mice, keypads, and other input peripherals use for communication. On Linux, this is implemented via the
USB client driver, which is responsible for the USB HID class (0x03).
registers itself as an input device driver. It conforms to the input API and reports input events appropriate to the connected HID.

Most input event drivers are present in the drivers/input/ directory. The keyboard event driver, however, lives in drivers/char/
, because it's connected to virtual terminals and not to device nodes under /
You can find input device drivers in several places. Drivers for legacy keyboards, mice, and joysticks, reside in separate subdirectories under drivers/input/. Bluetooth input drivers live in net/
/. You can also find input drivers in regions such as drivers/
/ and drivers/media/video/. Event types, codes, and values, are defined in include/
used in this chapter and their location inside the source tree.
that you used in this chapter along with the location of their definitions.

packet and send it to user space

CD Disk USB 등 많은것들을 들수있다 그러나 건반이 차치하는 몫은 매우 크다. 건반은 사용자와의 자유롭고 원할한 의사소통을 보장하는데서 중요한역할을 수행한다. 우리는 지금까지 매몰형체계에서의 keyboard부분과 buzzer(beep)에 대한 체계자원분석을 진행하였다. 과학과기술이 고도로 발전하고 있는 현시기 콤퓨터산업과 정보통신분야에서는 날에날마다 새로운 기술과 장치들이 개발되고 있으며 이에따라 매몰형체계에 대한 연구와 개발이 활발이 벌이지고 있다. 콤퓨터는 물론 그 규모와 크기가 집약화되고 소형화된 판형콤퓨터 손전화기 등 모든장치들에는 사용자와의 접촉을 실현하는 건반(keyboard)가 설치되여있다.따라서 건반에 대한 연구를 심화하여 발전하는 매몰형장치들의 수요에 맞게 사용자와의 효과적인 의사소통을 보장하는 건반에 대한 연구는 매우 중요하다. 매몰형체계에 대한 연구와 개발이 세계적으로 널리 진행되고 있는 조건에서 매몰형체계에서의 Keyboard부분에 대한 체계자원분석은 리론분야에서뿐아니라 실천적으로도 매우 중요한 의의를 가진다. 사용자콤퓨터의 입출력대면부의 편의를 보장하기 위하여 설계된 Keyboard를 지금은 거의 모든 전자장치들에서 쉽게 찾아볼수 있다. 수자식사진기, 인쇄기, 손전화기, IP전화기는 물론 전자악기 전기밥가마와같은 생활의 모든부분에서 쓰이는 전기제품들에는 매몰형체계와 입력을보장하는 건반이 설치되여있다.이번에 우리는 체계자원분석을 통하여 매몰형체계에서의Keyboard부분에 대한 리해뿐아니라 일반적인 환경속에서의 Keyboard의 특성과 그 동작과정에 대한 확고한 리해를 가지게 되였다. 특히 Keyboard에서 사용되는 여러가지 입출력규약들과 그에 기초한 Keyboard대면부지식, 련결방식과 동작원리들은 우리가 오래전부터 관심해오던것들로써 이번에 그에 대한 완벽한 리해를 가지게되였다.
우리는 이번 실습과제수행을 통하여 얻은 지식을 리용하여 매몰형체계에 련결되여 동작할수 있는 여러가지 장치들에 대한 추가를 비릇하여 실천에서 제기되는 문제들을 해결할수 있다는 새로운 자신심을 가지게 되였다.
우리는 발은 자기 땅에 붙이고 눈은 세계를 보라고 하신 경애하는
대원수님의 말씀을 가슴깊이 새기고 새 세기 산업혁명을 앞장에서 떠메고 나갈 선군혁명의 믿음직한 골간으로 자신들을 튼튼히 준비해 나가기 위해 전공부문 학습을 꾸준히 해나갈 굳은 결의를 다지면서 이번 실습과제가 우리들의 전공학습에 큰 도움을 주었다고 생각한다.
